intro: Lastrea varievestita, commonly known as the variable leaf lastrea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are often variegated, displaying a mix of green, white, and sometimes yellow hues. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
